translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽The Chapter on Worshipping the Bodhi Tree
The Elder Pāṭalipuppha
“The Fortunate One named Vipassī,🔽the self-becoming, foremost person,

analyzed: sayambhū agga puggalaḥ  purakkhataḥ sa sissehi
translated: was entered into Bandhumatī,
the Victor, with his disciples in front.
Three pāṭali flowers,
were placed on my shoulder;
Desiring to wash my head,
I went to the river bank.
Having left Bandhumatī,
I saw the Leader of the World;
Like a blue lotus in bloom,
like a fire that is burning.
Like a tiger or a bull,
like a well-born lion;
I saw the foremost of ascetics,
with the Community of monks in front.
I was pleased with the Fortunate One,
the cleanser of the stain of defilements;
Having taken the three flowers,
I worshipped the Buddha, the Best.
For ninety-one eons,
the flower I worshipped;
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
The four analytical insights,
… and so on …
The Buddha’s instruction has been done.”

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā pāṭalipupphiyo thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā pāṭalipupphiyaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: Thus has the venerable Pāṭalipupphiya told this verse.
The Story of the Elder Pāṭalipupphiya is finished.
